answers.answer: Your blood pressure is exactly (both numbers) what mine was last week. I am 31w4d. They were concerned and tested my urine for protein and there was none. They told me to come back in a week and I did on Tuesday. It was back down again at 112/70. I did nothing different, just tried to relax and reduce stress. I had preeclampsia with my first pregnancy and since this is my first pregnancy with my partner, the risk is up again. Have you asked your doctor if they have any suggestions? Are they monitoring you closely? I've done some of my own research about PIH and it is quite serious. I hope you can get yours to come down. I hope they check yours at the end of your visit and not just when you first get there. Lots of people get nervous and it goes up but then once they're relaxed at the end of the appt it isn't so high. Just knowing you have high blood pressure can cause it to shoot up in anticipation of them checking you!

Hi!I've had high blood pressure almost 5 yrs now.  The main things you need to do is:#1. No salts.  Those are found lots of  foods (especially frozen), some drinks and no extra salting your food#2. Drink more water than usual.  This helps with retention.#3. When Sleeping/Resting lay on your left side and elevate your feet.  Laying on your left side helps with the blood pressureGood Luck and I hope all goes well!!!V

Thanks for posting.  I am going back in two weeks and if it is elevated, he will have me come every week.  I have been checkiing periodically in Wal-Mart and Walgreens and it has been fine.  I think is must have just been because I was at the doctor.  He said there is really nothing that I can do at this point because it is simply my bodies response to the pregnancy, not just high blood pressure.  My husband has been out of town all week and dealing with my three year old can be stressful!  I am going to try to take it easy and leave a lot more responsibility to my husband.  He needs the practice anyway with another on the way, right!!  LOL.  I am glad your preseeure was down and I hope all goes well for you.  I can't believe we only have about 8 weeks left.  I had an ultrasound today to check weight and position.  Anna was head down and weighed about 4.1 pounds.  They are estimating right at 8 pounds at birth if I make it to my due date.  Have they given you an estimated size?

On Tuesday my little guy was head down and he guessed at least 4 lbs. He did an ultrasound quick to check his position. I hope your BP is down at your next visit. And YES-tell your hubby to do more with your toddler. It might help (:

i am 31w6d and my bp recently was elevated. i do suffer from hbp during preg. w/ ds i was on bedrest at the end and had very hbp. this time around it has been great and only in the last 2 wks has there been a small increase. i suggest:*relax as much as possible*try to cook w/o salt or minimal salt---i use mrs dash alot, sodium free*i found out the hard way that tomatos are loaded in sodium, 1st pg i craved tomatos and spagetti-i couldn't get enough tomatos*i just recently started swimming, my 2 yo ds loves it and it seems to relax me and cool me down all at once. also after swimming ds is so worn out he lays down for nice long nap!!

question: I am currently 31 weeks, 3 days pregnant and have felt great.  With my son three years ago, I was on bed rest at 33 weeks for pregnancy induced hypertension.  I never had pre-eclampsia.  Today when I went to the doctor my pressure was up to 136/86,  The bottom number is high for me and the doctor said anything over 90 is considered high.  I really don't want to do bed rest again and don't even see how I can with a 3 and half year old at home.  Is there anything I can do to help manage my blood pressure?  My weight gain is only 18 pounds and I feel good.
title: Any suggestions for keeping blood pressure down near the end?
